results.description:
RSVP HERE. Use code validately for free tickets

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/how-to-get-a-product-manager-job-and-grow-your-pm-career-tickets-19046603905?discount=VALIDATELY

Are you trying to break into product management? Come learn how to get that first PM job. We'll also cover how to grow your career once you're a product manager.  Our panel of PM experts will share advice and answer questions.

We plan to have an interactive discussion and will be crowdsourcing and answering questions from the audience in real time.

Timeline: 

6:30 - 6:45 pm - Meet & Greet

6:45 - 7:45 pm - Panel Discussion

7:45 - 8:30 pm - Networking      

*wine & refreshments will be provided


Takeaways:

• Understand the role and importance of product managers in today's tech industry.

• Get tactical tips from successful product managers on how to transition to product management and grow your career


Meet the Panelists:  

Carlos Gonzalez de Villaumbrosia

Carlos González de Villaumbrosia is the CEO of Product School. He has 8 years of experience building teams and digital products on 3 continents. He is a three times company Co-founder. Before Product School, he was the Lead Instructor of Product Management at General Assembly and Co-founder and CEO of Floqq (invested by 500Startups), the biggest marketplace for online video courses in Latin America.


Jeremy Horn is the Founder of The Product Group. He has 14 years of experience leading and managing product teams. Jeremy has held various executive and advisory roles, from founder of several start-ups to driving diverse organizations in online services, consumer products, and social media.


Rayyan Islam is VP of Product Product at Beacon and Investor at early-stage startups. He has worked with companies like Spotify, 406 Ventures, Lazard, and Deloitte to drive lasting impact and value to technology startups and enterprises. He is also the Product Management Instructor at Product School in New York 


About our Co-hosts:  

• The Product Group is the largest product management meetup in the world 

• Product School offers product management courses in San Francisco, Silicon Valley and New York.

• Validately is an end-to-end user research tool to take the pain out of recruiting testers, launching tests, and analyzing results.

• AlleyNYC is a co-working space that offers shared desks and private offices in Manhattan.
results.name: How to Get a Product Manager Job and Grow Your PM Career

results.description:
Schedule: 

6:30 - 6:45: Speed Networking 

6:45 - 7:00:  "Intro to NoSQL"  by Suhas Joshi (Solutions Architect at EMC Corporation)

7:00 - 7:15:   "NoSQL Hadoop Use Case" by Bhavna Sehgal (SDET at Syncsort)

7:15 - 8:00: "MongoDB for Dev and Ops" by Shawn McCarthy (Solutions Architect for MongoDB)

8:00 - 8:30: Open Space Group Discussion 

Other: 

Food and Refreshments provided (sponsored by MongoDB)  

Venue provided by ROKITT Inc

MongoDB for Dev and Ops

- Technical overview of MongoDB from both the perspective of the operations and development teams

- How can MongoDB fit in an Agile DevOps model

About Shawn McCarthy


Shawn McCarthy is a solutions architect at MongoDB. Shawn works with clients to better understand their production use cases  and the requirements needed to build out solutions that will help them to continue being successful.
Prior to MongoDB Shawn worked at BMC Software for three years as a consultant.e In this role he helped clients automate their infrastructure using BMC proprietary solutions.

About MongoDB:

By offering the best of traditional databases as well as the flexibility, scale, and performance required by today’s applications, MongoDB lets innovators deploy apps as big as they can possibly dream. From startups to enterprises, for the modern and the mission-critical, MongoDB is the database for giant ideas.

About ROKITT:


ROKITT develops digital products for consumers across various industries. It also drives solutions for enterprises to enable more efficient technology delivery.

ROKITT Products are developed to disrupt “old ways” and drive progressive evolution across multiple industries and segments. 

ROKITT Solutions are solving long standing IT operational challenges faced by enterprises by blending SME knowledge with revolutionary technology frameworks that accelerate IT execution strategy for Mobility, Quality, Data Management & Security.

ROKITT has established a global presence with offices in Jersey City, Ukraine and India.

Please visit www.rokittech.com to learn more

results.description:
As with trying anything new, everyone has to get started somewhere. The first question most people ask themselves is, "How Do I Actually Get Started?" or "Where Do I Begin?"

Our group will show you step by step and simplify the process of figuring out how YOU can get started.

We will also transport you far beyond the basics - deepening your financial knowledge, sharpening your skills, and increasing your arsenal of wealth-building tools.

We will cover every possible facet of real estate investing. We go beyond coursework to give individuals hands-on, in-the-field experience with a focus on applying their knowledge to the real world as quickly and profitably as possible. You can see that for yourself with our other upcoming scheduled events!

We are able to assist you in designing a customized, personal training plan, tailored to your individual needs, preferences, resources, and learning speed.

Are You Ready to Begin?

Our group wants to help those who want to help themselves. We want to empower those who want a better life.

If you are serious about becoming financially free, it's time for you get started.

"You Don't Have to be Great to Start, But You Have to Start to Be Great"- Zig Zigler

                                                  RSVP TODAY!!!!

Meet some of the coolest people in Astoria / who love Astoria. As always, our meetups are for folks who do and/or like creative things. Everyone is welcome!

Our host this month is QED, a comedy spot and after-school-program-for-adults space. If you haven't been up to the Ditmars area, this is your excuse.


Please support our hosts with a two-item minimum on the honor system. You can also show your support and have a great time by sticking around for the comedy show following the meetup at 9pm. More details about the show to come.

See you then!

RSVP here or on the Facebook Group Event.

- Emily of FindSpark & Nick of Wonderbot (your organizers!)

results.description:
This is a FREE event... but please support one of the artists featured this month!!!

Are you an artist? Did you study to be one but took another path? Is a family member or was an ancestor an artist? Do you “secretly” yearn to follow your artistic passion?

Bring your photos, letters, lockets or locks of hair, cameras, jewelry, paintbrushes, woodworking tools, aprons, books, paintings or prints & any other object that represents or connects you to art! Bring your ephemera, your textiles, tools & inspiration.

Think Pinterest/Instagram/TBT but in person. Bring an object & share its story.

Get to know one another through a personal story. Everyone is welcome to share with a 3 min limit.

Join us for the first, in a fall series, of our “Meet the Makers” events which will combine story sharing show & tell with a mini artist/crafter fair. Five artists will showcase their work & share their object and personal story.


Facebook link: https://www.facebook.com/events/173214103013808/

Support your local artists/crafters & share your art story!

Martie McNabb

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Networkand their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending. DO NOT SIGN UP FOR THIS EVENT UNLESS YOU WILL ACTUALLY COME. If you have any questions contact the organizer directly at [masked]. 

Blood Manor is back to scare the wits out of the Big Apple. A hit every year since 2005, it all takes place in the heart of New York City's Hudson Square District. This premier haunted attraction features a host of fright-filled environments, including the Fog of Death, Vestibule of the Undead, the Rue Morgue, Steampunk, Frozen Alive, the Banquet of Torture and Laser Spectacular, as well as all-new attractions Jungle Terror, Carnival of Souls and the Shocktorium, where the experiment's beginning ... and you are the subject! With dozens of cutting-edge animatronics, scores of state-of-the-art props and an average of 37 gallons of blood spilled each night, Blood Manor is bound to fulfill your darkest Halloween nightmares.

The group will meet in front of Jazzy's Restaurant then head to Blood Manor.  The actual experience at Blood Manor is about 30 minutes.  Following the experience you are invited to join the group for food and drink at a local tavern.

What to wear? most people are coming from work so business casual - casual

This event is being sponsored by  WWW.NEWYORKSOCIALNETWORK.COM and several Meet Up Groups.  The number of RSVP’s below reflect only a portion of those attending.  If you have any questions, please contact Dave Cervini at [masked] or call[masked]-2256. Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending. (We have a 3 flakes and you’re out rule)

Prepare: 

Install Node.js before arriving. We'll certainly be available to help get Node.js installed if you're having issues, but coming prepared will mean more time for coding!


Lesson Plan:

For this NodeSchool, you will have several lesson plans to choose from. You'll choose one.

INTRO TRACK (supported at every NodeSchool event): 


• JavaScripting

• LearnYouNode

IMMERSIVE TRACK: JAVASCRIPT (a new immersive track is offered every month):


• Scopes, Chains & Closures

• Functional JavaScript

• Planet Proto

• Regex Adventure

6:30 - 7:00: Mingle, drinks (including beer!), and pizza.

7:00 - 8:30: Get cracking on the Nodeschool workshops 

We'll be focusing on the workshops mentioned above, but attendees are welcome to try any of the workshops available.

Andrew Ingraham will facilitate the event.

Condé Nast is a premier media company renowned for producing the highest quality content for the world’s most influential audiences. Attracting 115 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital, and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, and Style.com. Built While Flying is Condé Nast’s digital team who is dedicated to growing our already rapidly expanding digital consumer base.

results.description:
Ever seen clients stand around a written report gesturing at various pages discussing the insights and their implications? …Didn’t think so.


In this appropriately visual talk Nick Bowmast will describe how he became so strongly biased towards using rich pictures to communicate insights and what they mean to his clients. He will share lots of examples from sketchy to polished work and will talk you through his creative process, so your design or UX research deliverables can get people talking too. 

The talk contains nudity, a tragic rocket-launching accident and a jar of very expensive wrinkle cream. You have been warned. :D 

…

About the presenter:

Nick is an independent design researcher from NZ with a broad design background in industrial, architectural and digital design.

He discovered the importance of understanding his own customers needs in the early 1990s as a custom surfboard maker. In this environment he learned the difference between what people say they want versus what they really need, and the value of working to a brief informed by reality.

Research and design collided for Nick in London, where he worked as a user researcher for UX and behavioural research agencies. Here he discovered user centred design and has since applied his instinct for finding out what makes people tick to shape experiences from hospitals to home brewing kits, mortgages to medical devices, TV apps to truckers maps.

Along the way, Nick couldn’t resist bringing his own product to market - Mr. Tappy, a mobile device recording rig. You can learn more about him on his website bowmast.com and reach him on Twitter @bowmast.
results.name: Visualizing Design Research with Nick Bowmast

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark
results.how_to_find_us: This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.
results.name: Thursday Night Board Games at Dave & Busters!

I'm loving the momentum of this group and witnessing how folks are improving their language skills and making friends. To me, it makes all of this worth doing!

So let's get ready for another great meetup! 

As always, first introduce yourself in the language you are studying. Then introduce yourself in your native language. 

Following that, we will dedicate 30 minutes towards helping those learning English, then 30 minutes of Chinese. 

Then we mingle again until its time to go. 

We are usually done by 8:30 but those that want to stick around or continue hanging out after the meetup (bubble tea, karaoke, etc) are more than welcome to do so!

Thanks again for your support thus far and let's have many more great meetups! 非常感谢大家的支持！

Trance Night – An Evening of Music, Trance and Dance for Evolutionary Change

October's Trance Night will be held on Thursday, October 22nd at The TRS Professional Suite, 40 Exchange Place, 3rd Floor.

Expect hypnotic stories, Milton Model language patterns and a whole lot of serious fun.

You will learn about the power of Neo-Ericksonian Hypnosis because you’ll experience it first hand.

Thursday evening, October 22nd

7:00pm – 9:00pm

* NOTE – Please arrive EARLY. Consider this a sacred space. Arriving late will disturb the process.

CLICK HERE - ONLY $22 (via PayPal)

Trance Night – As in previous trance nights, the trance induction while lying on the floor will be recorded so attendees can download it later on.


Doug O'Brien
Certified Master Practitioner and Trainer of Neuro-Linguistic Programming; Ericksonian Hypnotherapist
­http://www.dougobrienhypnosis.com
http://www.ericksonian.com

As a Hypnotherapist, Doug helped found the Department of Complementary Medicine at Columbia Presbyterian Hospital in the mid-nineties, under Dr. Mehmet Oz. Doug worked directly with pre-operative and post-operative patients on stress management and pain reduction as well as long term behavioral change to generate healthy living.

Doug O'Brien, is an NLP Master Trainer - originally given that designation by Anthony Robbins over 20 years ago - and is called a modern Shaman by some. He is also a musician and composer and a Trance Master Guide.

He is the guy who gave Tony Robbins an insight that completely changed Tony's approach to his second book (it was going to be called "The Niagara Syndrome" and became, instead, "Awaken the Giant Within")

Doug is the guy who has been the success coach to two of the top internet marketers in the country as well as corporate executives, top musical artists, fashion designers and professional athletes.

He has helped literally tens of thousands of people quit smoking in one session.
He has helped similar numbers lose weight and keep it off through the power of Hypnosis.

He can help YOU, too.

Endorsements/Testimonials

results.description:
New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life, Q & A, and Alchemy and the Tarot. All questions will be answered and we will learn some simple spreads. Everyone is encouraged to participate.

Everyone is welcome.

There will be a Meet-up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class. 

This is a revolving class. It will be a comprehensive study of the Temperance card from the Major Arcana. The "Majors" are all done individually, so even if you begin now, as long as you know a little Tarot, you will be fine. Other cards can be filled in at another time.  

So, come join with other like-minded people who enjoy Tarot as much as you do. Let's talk Tarot, in a safe, convenient Manhattan location and have some fun at the same time.

Join us!

Dear Friends and Lovers,


Our Thursday night Tantra Playground is here!!!


Cannot wait to re-connect and play with all of you, Beautiful Lovers! As always, we will have surprises for you! 

LOCATION:

MBR (moving body resources)

112 West 27th Street Suite 400

(between 6 & 7 Ave)

New York, NY 10001

October 22

TIME:7-10pm

During this class we will explore principles of Tantra that can be easily integrated into your every day life. Through breathing and connection exercises you will learn to improve communication skills, deepen intimacy in your relationships, both with yourself and others. 

Learn to quiet the mind and leave goal oriented patterns behind thus allowing the true sensual energy to guide us.

This is an experiential class. Nudity and explicit sexual activity are not part of the class.

Learn ways of deepening your existing relationships , make new connections and open your heart to LOVE. This group is so much more than just a Tantra group, It has to be EXPERIENCED.

Come Play in the Field of Sensuality, Sexuality and Vulnerability. Let's explore our deepest selves in a Safe and Edgy Environment. Connect to yourself and others in a deep energetic way. Free yourself from sexual guilt, shame and fear. Learn to stay present in your own body while connecting to others in a conscious sensual way.


LET'S PLAY TOGETHER ! This class will be a fun and experiential place to bring all of ourselves in a loving, safe and supportive community. It will be a facilitated group for all levels of experience 

In this group we will explore the following:

Tantra Work, Loving Touch & Massage, Orgasmic Breathing, Sacred Sexuality, Energetic Love and Intimacy, Full Body Orgasm, Eye Gazing, Fantasies, Fetishes and Erotic Pleasures, Dance and Movement, Self Acceptance and Communication, Full Sensual Expression, Cuddling, Puja: "Honoring of the Divine Feminine and Masculine", Synchronized Breathing, Sensual Eating, Body and Emotional Release work and much much more...

PLEASE RSVP SO WE COULD MAINTAIN GENDER AND SEXUAL ORIENTATION BALANCE.

He is also a successful businessman and owns a Contracting and Management Company and is a father to a beautiful son Nicholas. results.description:
The Indo-American Arts Council is holding its second annual literary festival. The event features latest works by established authors and newcomers to the South Asian literary world, plus panels that cover cross-over mediums of storytelling and the ins and outs of the publishing industry. 

I'll be flying in from Detroit to attend, and would be happy to meet afterwards on Sunday to chat about favorite panels over coffee/chai, if there is interest.


Some key highlights include: 

• Bombay boys in New York Salman Rushdie and Suketu Mehta will be in conversation about the two cities Bombay and New York. Both authors have written extensively about both cities - the fecund and the dazzle, cities which aren't typical of either of the two countries they inhabit. Suketu wrote Maximum City Bombay Lost & Found and is currently writing a book on New York in the same vein. Salman has referenced and set several of his novels in Bombay and his current book Two Years, Eight Months and Twenty-Eight Nightsopens in New York with a trip to Bombay.
 

• Historical Fiction: Shared Histories, New Interpretations Authors: Khushwant Singh, Manreet Sodhi Someshwar, Sudipto Roy Choudhury

This panel brings together authors whose contemporary narratives are set against the backdrop of major historical events of the sub-continent and beyond: from the events of the Partition, to the legacy of the Sikhs, to the confluence of Indian, Chinese and European history in the colonial outpost of Singapore during World War 

• Everything Starts With the Written Word  Authors: Padma Lakshmi

Meet the author of two cookbooks and the ex-syndicated columnist for the New York Times and style columnist of Harpers Bazaar as she discusses how her work as a writer launched her career in food and TV, including two culinary shows on the food network, her Emmy nominated role as host & executive producer of the hit series Top Chef, the world of retail table top hard goods with the Padma Collection, as well as her culinary company Easy Exotic, which sells teas, and organic frozen rice. Padma will discuss her journey from her first cookbooks to where she is today
results.name: Second Annual IAAC Literary Festival

results.description:
Have you ever heard of this hit show? It is gem of a show on Adult Swim that is easy to miss. It stars a super scientist and his young grandson in a host of nutty comedic adventures.

If you watch just one episode you may be tempted to disregard it because of the juvenile humor (burping, etc) that entertains the weak of mind. This would be a mistake. Rick & Morty is actually a brilliant exploration of various science fiction tropes. In a meaner reworking of Back to the Future's zany super-scientist Emmet Brown, Rick Sanchez takes a young wide-eyed high school student Marty McFly on various adventures. However, in today's modern world an old scientist frequently sneaking off alone with a teen would be considered far creepier than it was in the 80's. Therefore they have swapped out "Marty" for "Morty", Sanchez's 14 year old grandson (see, a lot less creepy!). Together they use comedy to deconstruct, from unexpected and unique angles, various sci-fi, television, and real world assumptions. Some of these shows are simply brilliant and hilarious. (How they portray the Borg is simply too funny to be believed).

So come hang out with us. It's Bring Your Own Food, and you are also welcome to bring your own drinks as well, if you want something to drink besides the free alcohol we are providing (scotch, whiskey, and/or vodka while supplies last).


Please join us for the fun tonight.

Not sure you'll be on time? No worries. Come as soon as you can.

Not sure you can stay for the whole event? No worries. We want you to join us for as much time as you can.

See you tonight!
results.name: Free Drinks and a Show: Rick & Morty Introduction

results.description:
Pulling ahead by one vote, we'll be reading The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet by Becky Chambers. This book is really charming and delightful, and I think it will be interesting to see how this book (written in 2014) addresses futuristic notions of gender and race, albeit in a much lighter setting!

From Goodreads:

Somewhere within our crowded sky, a crew of wormhole builders hops from planet to planet, on their way to the job of a lifetime. To the galaxy at large, humanity is a minor species, and one patched-up construction vessel is a mere speck on the starchart. This is an everyday sort of ship, just trying to get from here to there. 

But all voyages leave their mark, and even the most ordinary of people have stories worth telling. A young Martian woman, hoping the vastness of space will put some distance between herself and the life she‘s left behind. An alien pilot, navigating life without her own kind. A pacifist captain, awaiting the return of a loved one at war. 

Set against a backdrop of curious cultures and distant worlds, this episodic tale weaves together the adventures of nine eclectic characters, each on a journey of their own.

PS - I'm also going to drop a couple books from our current list as they're not getting a lot of love in the polls. This should also make it easier to come to a stronger group majority when we vote.
results.name: October Book Club - The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet

results.description:
TICKETS ON EVENTBRITE

---------------------------------------

Please note that you must have a ticket from Eventbrite to attend.

RSVP'ing on Meetup alone will not get you in.

The Point of Prototyping

Presented by Doug DeMarco, Senior UX Developer at Spotify</a>


Price: <a href="http://www.designersandgeeks.com/events/point-of-prototyping?utm_source=prototyping_meetup&utm_medium=meetup&utm_campaign=prototyping_nyc">$15 for early birds, $20 for regular


Turning a design into a final product can be a magical yet difficult process. Prototyping not only helps you cast the right spell but also suffer less while doing so. "The Point of Prototyping" is a high-level chat about the art of creating and using prototypes. We'll discuss what user-experience prototyping is, how it has helped Spotify, and how it can help you and your organization.

Doug DeMarco is a designer and front-end developer with a recent focus in the ad tech industry. Prior to working at Spotify he ran a successful web design & development business and has worked with companies such as Accenture, Microsoft, and Vibrant Media.


Connect

We post discounts & freebies here:

Our Newsletter • Designers + Geeks Facebook • @DesignersGeeks


Satisfaction Guarantee

We organize this group to promote innovation, creativity, and the benefits of new technology. If you purchase a ticket and aren't happy with the experience, can't make it, or decide that you don't want to support the community for any reason, we're happy to refund your money.

Please note that if you do need to cancel your reservation, we request that you do so at least 24 hours before the event so that the tickets can be shared with others who may be waiting.
results.name: The Point of Prototyping

results.description:
Head on over to our user group page to RSVP: http://aug.atlassian.com/cities/newyorkny/annualpre-summitbash

It's that time of year!! Atlassian Summit in San Francisco is only a few weeks away, and our local NYC members made us proud by being chosen to present during the conference. For any of us who can't fly out to SF, this event is a perfect way to get your Summit fix!

We will hear the practice presentation runs from Ethan Foulkes of Camerican, Madhusudhan Matrubhai of Barclays, and Justin Riservato of Gilt! More information in the agenda below.

Don't miss this fun event! We will have raffles, whiskey tasting, sushi, other food and drinks, great conversations, and much more!

IInterested in live Jira training? Use code B1G1FREE for Buy-One-Get-One on ServiceRocket's Oct 19th NYC session.

Agenda

7:00PM

Networking, eating, and drinking / Welcome from AUG NYC leaders

7:20PM

The Project Management Comeback

by Justin Riservato, Gilt

Project Managers often face an identity crisis when companies transition to agile: either become a scrum master, move to another role entirely, or another company! This discussion will demonstrate how project management can not only co-exist with your agile process, but thrive. Plus, you'll learn how Gilt blends agile principles with traditional project management techniques to bring their strategic initiatives to life.

About the speaker:

Justin Riservato has been an integral part of Gilt’s growth since 2009. Justin has worked with just about every team and department at Gilt, developing a direct, “tell the truth” approach and philosophy to project communication that has improved both collaboration and trust across teams. From his past life of living and working on sailboats, Justin has been able to draw numerous parallels between program management and working on a ship—at least the way he does it!

7:40PM

Just-In-Time Business Operations (Yeah, there's an add-on for that!)

by Ethan Foulkes, Camerican

Learn how Camerican International, one of the worlds largest food import/export companies, has integrated numerous add-ons in Confluence to build a custom CRM on a limited budget and without any in-house programmers. The Atlassian ecosystem is full of existing add-ons you can use, as well as developers looking for new ideas to build. Understanding how to manage multiple add-ons and work with the various vendors is the key to unlocking huge value. Come see what’s possible!

About the speaker: 

Always an IT nerd at heart Ethan started off his career in tech support, originally in dial-up modem support and eventually as a Network Security Engineer. In his early 20's he departed from this promising career track to play professional poker. 8 years later, having successfully competed at the highest levels it was time for a new challenge. In his current role, Ethan develops custom business tools by extending Confluence through add-ons. His people skills, honed through years of poker playing, help him to understand what motivates people and use that to drive adoption of those tools. Ethan has an amazing wife and an energetic 5 year old son who keeps him active. Time is valuable but he still manages to find enough to help run the NYC Atlassian User Group.

8:00PM

Agile Development with Chuck Norris

by Madhusudhan Matrubai, Barclays

The session gives a brief overview on the challenges that an Agile development team faced before adopting agile tools, it walks through on how adopting the Chuck Norris suite transformed an ordinary Agile team into power packed ChuckAgile Team. The suite consists of various Atlassian tools like Confluence, Jira, Bitbucket (including Stash), Bamboo and Jira Service Desk and is referred here as "Chuck Norris" for obvious reasons of agility, flexibility, traceability and various other adjectives. The session highlights on how the integration between these tools contributed for a greater transparency, traceability, collaboration and increased productivity. Agility redefined by Chuck Norris.

About the speaker:

Entered into the earth portal from the city of Bangalore, India. Did my Bachelors of Engineering in Instrumentation Technology from Sri Jayachamarajendra College of Engineering, Mysore - India. I have over 13 yrs of Experience in IT and have performed various kinds of roles and I like my current role in the DevOps area in the banking industry in Big Apple.

8:20PM

More eating, drinking, networking!
results.how_to_find_us: http://aug.atlassian.com/cities/newyorkny/annualpre-summitbash
results.name: Annual Pre-Summit Bash!

results.description:
Greetings Dear Friends,

Greetings Dear Friends,


In this session, we'll release conditioning that keeps us stuck in bad habits, compulsions and addictions. We could call it the OCD session (obsessive / compulsive disease). If we dig deep enough into these issues, we'll always find that they're sourced in fear, and that underneath the fear there is a wealth of buried spiritual treasure - insights, wisdom, talents, creativity, love and joy.
Please be informed that this is the last session we'll do at the old rate of $20. We set that fee 7 yrs. ago and since then both Carol and I have spent thousands of dollars on higher trainings and have become much more adept and accomplished as healers, not to mention that the cost of living has risen substantially. So after this session, the in person fee will be $25 and the distant fee will be $22. This new fees will help cover the processing fee for PayPal payments and the cost of renting Madison Wellness Center for the event, as well as putting a few extra dollars in our pockets. I'll think you'll agree that that's not too much to ask considering what you're getting for your money!


In the 7 yrs that we've been doing these sessions, they've become my most popular event, averaging 25 - 35 people. You can come in person or sign up for the distant healing list (you can put your pets on the distant healing list for free). I've kept the cost of low ($20) because I'm committed to providing low cost high quality holistic services which the average working person can take advantage of regularly if they wish. There's some testimonials below, and many more on my website. If you are coming in person please arrive at Madison Wellness by 7pm (THE DOOR WILL BE LOCKED AT 7:30PM) and pay when you arrive in cash or credit / debit card (don't use Paypal if you're coming in person - they take out a fee). If you are on the distant list, the energy will run from 7:45pm - 8:45pm EST. There is no conference call or video feed for the distant session, simple lie or sit down in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed from 7:45pm - 8:45pm. PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS BELOW VERY CAREFULLY IF YOU ARE REGISTERING FOR THIS EVENT!


Registration Instructions

In order to register, you must email me at [masked] stating that you are coming in person or that you want to be put on the distant list. For distant participation, give me your full name as you want it written on the distant list. Then you can Paypal me your $20 by going to the contact page of my website and clicking on the "Make Payment Now" button. This will take you to my PayPal page. If you don't have a PayPal account, click on "Don't have a PayPal account?" on the lower right and fill in the fields with your credit or debit card info. Participants are encouraged to make a written or mental list of their intentions for the session. What do you want to heal, let go of, bring in or enhance in your life (your intentions don't have to be directly related to the theme). We don't have to know what your intentions are, we simply channel with the intent to address whatever you want and need. If you don't have specific goals for the session, just ask for "whatever is best for me". It's best to lie or sit down in a quiet place where you won't be disturbed for the session. Here's some testimonials -


"That was and still is the most amazing healing ever. My ears filled with a ringing sound so loud and my heart was pounding seemingly out of my chest. I wanted the fear to stop. Then a waterfall of pure light fell over and through me and I calmed to a beautiful inner light. My ears are still ringing and I know that to be the angels singing!"
Beautiful! L.Z. (distant participant in California)


"Wow! I just wanted to thank you so much for last night's distant vortex session. It was one of the most powerful sessions I've had from you and Carol before and as you know I'm a regular, ha! The last 30 min I felt as if my heart was opening up to pure loving energy and it was indescribable."
Thank you so much,
S. B. (distant participant in Toronto)


"Amazing!! I felt so exhilarated, excited yet deeply @ peace. I'm still feeling the peace and tranquility." - M.B.

"wow. you guys...just wow. such a delivery of clarity to me in this one. great calmness to my heart and clarity to my mind. was able to let so much go that the energy leaving my field was palpable. no problem because it was followed by a great wave of love and i am still floating awash in an emotional sea of realizing/manifesting the next leg of the voyage. blessings my beautiful friends." C.S.J. (distant participant in Texas)

"I must say that last nights session was very profound. It feels like everything has come together. I wasn't feeling great for a couple of weeks and I was losing faith and courage in all things. I was ready to ditch all spiritual pursuits. After last nights integration / harmonization session I feel invigorated and motivated again. Thanks to both of you for providing these sessions!" KC - (distant participant in Toronto)

"I have gotten 3 distant group VortexHealing® sessions and I just wanted to say it is incredible how powerful it feels each time. Even the times I wasn't able to to fully concentrate and enjoy the experience, I felt such a sense of joy and upliftment wash over me when I was doing tasks and I knew this was real what I was experiencing. I suffer from depression and each session makes me feel like a child at my healthiest and happiest state, or as if I am on a very high dose of anti - depressants without the terrible side effects. It means so much to me and I just want to thank you so much - you truly have a gift!" SB (distant participant in Toronto)

"The session was fabulous, afterward I felt light as a feather. It's hard to put the experience into words ... felt like my soul was being caressed" Jane (distant participant in Montreal)

"Geordie - Thanks for getting back to me. I put through a "tip" for the session Thursday. It was very peaceful and deeply healing for me. I woke up yesterday and the virus I've been living with for the last 5 weeks had begun to clear. I'm also looking forward to the benefits I've noticed from other sessions that go on for months after! Thanks so much!" Susan (distant participant in NYC)


Love & Gratitude,
Geordie Numata
Usui Reiki & Karuna Reiki® Master/Teacher
LifeForm Level VortexHealing® Practitioner
Counseling Astrologer
N.A.D.A Certified Acupuncture Detox Specialist

A special screening will be held as we join thousands across the nation in celebration of the 50 year anniversary of A Course in Miracles.

$10 donation 

The first twenty who prepay using PayPal on our website will receive a FREE bottle of water blessed by John Of God.

results.description:
Our first meetup as an official DevShop!



MEETUP AGENDA 


7:00pm - Featured Presentations


  Eric Typaldos - Meteor on the Desktop - Using Electron with Meteor + DDP


"Web apps are great, but there can be limitations when an app only lives in the browser. At Hive we needed a way to work with one such limitation: access to the user’s filesystem. Using Meteor with Electron and native node modules was our solution. In this talk I'll explore the benefits that Electron provided in the case of Hive and some other interesting potential use cases for Meteor + Electron."

Eric Typaldos is a co-founder at Hive, a team collaboration application (http://hiveteams.com). Reach out to him at: [masked]

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.name: Each Thurs. from 7-9pm  Happiness and Goodness at Barnes & Noble in White Plains

results.description:
The East River Park track is east of the FDR at East 6th Street. It is a little over a mile from the closest subway stops (6 to Astor Place or L to First Ave).

Thursday workouts change from week to week and will be announced in advance.

Important Information about East River Park Track: The Whippets have been running here for three years and have experienced thefts of our belongings. We will take extra precautions to keep our bags safe, but please avoid bringing valuables -- and it would be safest to run with your wallet on you.

Please be aware that there are limited overhead lights, so it gets a little dark, and during winter months the bathrooms are locked and the water fountains are off. If you have a bike, make sure you have a lock because you'll have to keep your bike outside the track area.

If you feel uncomfortable leaving your personal belongings at the track, you can drop them off at Ace Bar (531 East 5th Street between A and B) -- ask for Justin or Charlo and tell them you run with the team.  They will store our belongings for us.  ***Please note that they will not let you in without your ID so please bring that with you to the track.   http://www.acebar.com/about.html

See you there -- and please contact a Whippet captain if you have any questions!
results.name: East River Park Track Workout

results.description:
Its open board game night! Grab some friends and your favorite board game and head on over to the Highlander location in Boonton to have some fun.  Don't have a game, or interested in playing a new one?  We've got an extensive demo library open to everyone so feel free to pick whichever game strikes your fancy, grab a group, and play. 


Additionally there will be a featured demo of a different game each week, I'll be updating this meetup each week so you guys know what we've got. 


Other than that feel free to use this meetup as a way to organize your own games for Thursday nights, we've got space for everyone and plenty of people already show up so picking up a group should be no problem at all.  Hope to see you there!
results.name: Open Board Game Night

results.description: Kirtan is a form of devotional chanting whose roots go back over 500 years to India. It is a form of Bhakti Yoga (yoga of devotion) and has the power to open the heart. Musical instruments and rhythmic drumming accompany the singing and the attendees are encouraged to participate by chanting, clapping and dancing. You will not be able to resist the urge to join in! In its heartfelt expression, kirtan can induce profound states of meditation, bliss and ecstasy. There is a sweet sound vibration that permeates through all layers of coverings and makes God dance. That sound vibration is Kirtan. It is a mysterious connection that draws people to each other.
results.name: Kirtan! Mantra Meditation

results.description:
For Halloween, something a little scary: Octavia Butler's weird vampire tale Fledgling, the last novel she completed before her untimely death in 2006. 

Here's the blurb:  "Fledgling, Octavia Butler's first new novel in seven years, is the story of an apparently young, amnesiac girl whose alarmingly unhuman needs and abilities lead her to a startling conclusion: She is in fact a genetically modified, 53-year-old vampire. Forced to discover what she can about her stolen former life, she must at the same time learn who wanted-and still wants-to destroy her and those she cares for and how she can save herself."

We'll meet at Cafe Madline in Ditmas Park again, just down from the Q/B at Cortelyou. Hope to see you there!

results.name: Book Discussion: Fledgling, by Octavia Butler

results.description:
Join us on for three talks on algorithmic trading, great food, and a chance to meet other members in our community. 

The Search for the Holy Grail of Investing

It has been said that diversification is the only free lunch.* Yet, achieving consistent diversification across many distinct quantitative investment strategies each with limited life-spans can quickly become a very expensive research problem.


Join Dr. Jess Stauth, vice president of Quant Strategy at Quantopian, and learn about the tools and techniques Quantopian is developing to select and invest in algorithms sourced from a crowd of over 50,000 quants, hackers, data scientists and finance geeks.

Read ahead by checking out pyfolio, the open-sourced Python library for performance and risk analysis developed by Quantopian. 

http://quantopian.github.io/pyfolio/

How to Build a Long-Short Equity Strategy and the New Pipeline API

Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie will review how to build a long-short equity strategy and Karen Rubin will show you how to use the new Pipeline API when building these types of algorithms. With the addition of the pipeline, you can now dynamically select portfolios from the entire universe of 8000+ securities. This enables factor modeling, custom screening, and more statistically robust strategies.

https://www.quantopian.com/

*Food and drinks will be served at the event.


Where: BlackRock, Auditorium 11D/E, 11th Floor 55 E 52nd Street , New York, NY 10055. Please go up the escalators as soon as you enter the building and present you ID at the BlackRock reception.


Speakers

Jess Stauth is Quantopian's VP of Quant Strategy. Jess holds a PhD from UC Berkeley in Biophysics and has worked as an equity quant analyst at the StarMine Corporation and as a Director of Quant Product Strategy for Thomson Reuters prior to joining Quantopian in August of 2013. 

Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie is an engineer at Quantopian who focuses on how Quantopian can be used as a teaching tool. After studying computer science at Princeton, Delaney joined Quantopian in 2014. Since then he has led successful course integrations at MIT Sloan and Stanford, and is working with over 20 courses for this fall. Delaney is using his experience and feedback from professors to build a quantitative finance curriculum focusing on best statistical practices to be offered for free. 

Karen Rubin has spent the past 10 years building products and managing product development teams. She is currently the VP of product at Quantopian, where they are building the world’s first crowd sourced hedge fund. She is focused on expanding and improving their algorithmic trading tools so that the community of 50,000 quants can create great, fundable strategies.

Want to learn more about Quantopian? Visit us at: www.quantopian.com.
results.name: Crowd-Sourced Alpha, Long-Short Strategies, and the new Pipeline API

results.description:
Explore Southeast Asia from Thailand to Cambodia.


October 22, 2015, 7:00 - 8:30 p.m.

Looking to find your adventure through Southeast Asia?  Hungering to get off the beaten path and immerse yourself into the culture?  HI New York and our workshop presenter Ruth Arber are here to help.  Southeast Asia is one of the most highly regarded backpackers' destinations in the world, with affordable lodging & food, beautiful sights and a culture that inspires mystery and intrigue all at once. 

This workshop will help you plan the ideal trip to the region, highlighting unique itineraries and routes depending on your interests and travel experience.  We'll also provide you with invaluable tips and tricks for getting from one place to another.  Ruth will provide you with insights from her own trip to Thailand and Cambodia, sharing her travels and her volunteer experiences in Cambodia.  You're guaranteed to walk away with the inspiration and tools you need to finally realize your adventure through Southeast Asia.


About Our Presenter

Ruth, 29, originally from London, works as a strategy specialist for an ad tech company.  An avid traveller she took her first big trip at 18 and travelled the world for 10 months, visiting: Thailand, Cambodia, Australia, Fiji, New Zealand and South America.  She spent 3 months in Africa teaching English & Computer skills at a school in Zanzibar, and is currently planning her next trip to Central America.  Having travelled with friends and along, she has a wealth of stories and advice to share with anyone seeking a new adventure.  Join her on October 22 to learn about her experiences in Southeast Asia.
results.how_to_find_us: At the corner of 103rd Street in Amsterdam Avenue
results.name: Travel Workshop: Southeast Asia on a Shoestring

results.description:
Left your costume choice until the last minute?  Need one last detail to finish up your costume; like the right pair of shoes, mask, or piece of fabric?  Did you get a new costume for a theme party, only to realize that you have 10 other costumes in your closet, and you need to downsize?  Stop by and browse what other people are getting rid of, and score some great finds just before the costume parties and trick-or-treat chaperoning! 

Adults and kids costumes are acceptable, as well as Halloween decorations. If possible please post pictures and/or descriptions of what you're bringing, so people know what's available and can bring their own similar items to trade.

The name says it all.  Join us for a hot Sichuan dinner in Flushing.  

Dinner will be family-style.  Everyone will pay an equal share of the final food bill, including tax and tip, and pay an additional $1 toward the Meetup Organizer dues.  (It is free to be a Meetup member, but not to be a Meetup organizer.)  Cash only.  Estimated cost per person is $22-30.  You will pay for your own drinks and individual desserts, if any.

Do not RSVP if you do not want to eat real spicy Sichuan food. 

By attending, you agree to be responsible for your own dietary restrictions, allergies, health and general welfare.

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00. New students first class is $12.00, either RSVP or just show up. Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial Arts room- can't miss us.
results.name: Krav Maga Level One (NYSC)

group.name: Krav Maga Basics, Rape Defense- NYC Midtown (Kravmaguy)

results.description:
Comedy Club Night Out For Singles! (Must Pre-Pay Online)
Get Full Event Details & Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html

Have some laughs, make some new friends and enjoy a fun night out of mingling and then comedy... Oh, and maybe even meet that special someone! This event is for singles (no couples). We will meet ahead of time at 7:30 for a pre-mingle at a bar (The Three Monkeys Bar - 236 W. 54 St) down the block from the comedy club where you can meet the other friendly singles who will be attending the comedy show. Our event host for the night will facilitate introductions (Basically this means that someone will be there to casually make sure you get to meet at least some of the people in the group so absolutely no one is left out. We encourage a friendly attitude from all attending and honestly this event usually attracts really nice, friendly people). We will then all head to the comedy club at 8:30. We have a section (tables) reserved at Broadway Comedy Club.

IMPORTANT: The Comedy Show Starts At 9:00 PM At Broadway Comedy Club But We Will Be Meeting For A Pre-Mingle At 7:30 At The Three Monkeys Bar (236 W. 54 St. between Broadway and 8th Ave) Which Is Just 1 Block Over And We Then Head Over To The Comedy Club Together. Look For Our Reserved Section At Three Monkeys Bar With Our "Reserved For Click Event Meetup" Sign. If You Can't Make It To The Pre-Mingle, Simply Meet Us At The Comedy Club At 8:40 (You'll See Our Reserved Section There As Well).

TICKETS: $22 (You Must Pre-Pay Online. Tickets Will Not Be Sold At The Event). Get Full Event Details & YourTickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html

We don't completely gender balance this event, meaning that sometimes we have more women than men and sometimes we have more men than women. If you don't meet that special someone you will still have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with!). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

Everyone will have their own individual check for any drinks or food they order at the Bar or Comedy Show...
The comedy club has a 2 drink minimum per person.
If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order 2 sodas.

TICKETS: $22 (You Must Pre-Pay Online. Tickets Will Not Be Sold At The Event). Get Full Event Details & Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html
results.name: Comedy Club Night Out For Singles! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

results.description:
How signing up works: First come first serve

The Place:

I found this place in a NY Times list where they really like it:

http://www.nytimes.com/2015/06/03/dining/hungry-city-punda-tibetan-sunnyside-queens.html

It's also very affordable, with almost every item under $10:

https://www.grubhub.com/restaurant/punda-tibetan-restaurant-3935-47th-ave-sunnyside/305295?utm_source=http:%2F%2Fwww.pundatibetanrestaurant.com&utm_medium=nitrosites&utm_medium=nitrosites&utm_campaign=order%20online&utm_campaign=order%20online&classicAffiliateId=%2Fr%2Fw%2F29459%2Fnyc%2Fpunda-tibetan-restaurant-47th-ave%2F%3Futm_source

Given that Yelp gives it 4.5 stars, I think we must try it. Even though it is in Queens, it is just only a 20 minute subway ride from midtown. For those that have never been to Queens, this part is incredibly safe (only mentioning this because some people have asked this question in the past)- just as safe as Manhattan. The restaurant is also very close to the subway.

Gold medalist chef Tenzing Tsering has opened second Tibetan Restaurant in New York. He focused mostly in healthy food and specially in steamed dumplings

RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Punda Tibetan

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

Every Thursday night at HobbyTown is board game night!

We have dozens of games available for use ranging from deckbuilding games like Dominion and DC, to worker placement games like Stone Age and Caylus to bluffing games like The Resistance and everything in between.

results.description:
If you joined this group to better your public speaking skills and haven't made it out to one meetup yet, this your chance.

No preparation, no excuses!

We will work together in a very supportive and encouraging environment to practice our public speaking skills by doing a couple of rounds of impromptu speaking. 

There'll be NO OFFICIAL INSTRUCTOR - just a chance for you to get up there and practice. 

You will gain confidence and get meaningful feedback from a supportive group of people, not to mention have a great time!

Leader: Taylor 

(There's a small fee to help pay the monthly meetup organizer subscription).

results.description:
Comedy Club Night Out For Singles! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get Full Event Details & Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html

Have some laughs, make some new friends and enjoy a fun night out of mingling and then comedy... Oh, and maybe even meet that special someone! This event is for singles (no couples). We will meet ahead of time at 7:30 for a pre-mingle at a bar (The Three Monkeys Bar - 236 W. 54 St) down the block from the comedy club where you can meet the other friendly singles who will be attending the comedy show. Our event host for the night will facilitate introductions (Basically this means that someone will be there to casually make sure you get to meet at least some of the people in the group so absolutely no one is left out. We encourage a friendly attitude from all attending and honestly this event usually attracts really nice, friendly people). We will then all head to the comedy club at 8:30. We have a section (tables) reserved at Broadway Comedy Club.

IMPORTANT: The Comedy Show Starts At 9:00 PM At Broadway Comedy Club But We Will Be Meeting For A Pre-Mingle At 7:30 At The Three Monkeys Bar (236 W. 54 St. between Broadway and 8th Ave) Which Is Just 1 Block Over And We Then Head Over To The Comedy Club Together. Look For Our Reserved Section At Three Monkeys Bar With Our "Reserved For Click Event Meetup" Sign. If You Can't Make It To The Pre-Mingle, Simply Meet Us At The Comedy Club At 8:40 (You'll See Our Reserved Section There As Well).

TICKETS: $22 (You Must Pre-Pay Online. Tickets Will Not Be Sold At The Event). Get Full Event Details & YourTickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html

We don't completely gender balance this event, meaning that sometimes we have more women than men and sometimes we have more men than women. If you don't meet that special someone you will still have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with!). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring a friend. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

Everyone will have their own individual check for any drinks or food they order at the Bar or Comedy Show...
The comedy club has a 2 drink minimum per person.
If you don't drink alcohol, you're welcome to order 2 sodas.

TICKETS: $22 (You Must Pre-Pay Online. Tickets Will Not Be Sold At The Event). Get Full Event Details & Your Tickets At: http://www.clickmixers.com/comedynyc.html

Let's meet each other over food and drinks! Will determine location and other details when people RSVP....or....if nobody RSVPs will just console myself with those drinks.

UPDATE: Hey guys, of all the beer and bakery (I tried for you Eleanor!) locations that I called, only the beer authority was sufficiently accommodating for a group of our size at that time. So while we'll try to mix up locations in the future, this meeting is set for the Beer Authority (300 W 40th St New York, NY 10018 b/t 9th Ave & 8th Ave). 


As Deidre said, it's really close to many subway lines and I hope you can come! Please bring cash if you can as it'll be easier to settle out the bill and they will limit how many credit cards are used in a party our size. Really looking forward to it!

results.description:
Start the weekend with some FREE LAUGHS!!

This Thursday at 8pm I'm hosting a FREE LIVE COMEDY SHOW at the Village Lantern, right in the heart of historic Greenwich Village!!


Come w. a friend, or come solo.


All comics performing on the show are professionals and have been featured on Comedy Central, MTV, Late Night TV (Letterman, Fallon, Conan, etc) + MORE!! Being just around the corner from the legendary Comedy Cellar, we regularly get special guest drop in's from some of the biggest names in comedy!!


The Village Lantern is located at 167 Bleeker St. Trains Stations Nearby: W. 4th St- D/B/M/F/A/C/E, Bleeker St- 6, Christopher St- 1

Meetup and hang out in the bar area from 730-8 and join us downstairs in the Comedy Club at 8 for the FREE SHOW!!

The Lantern offers a full bar and food menu, including $5 Comedy Show specials including:
$5 Can of Beer
$5 Well Drink
$5 Glass of Wine

Food:
$5 Mozzarella Sticks,
$5 Fresh Cut Fries
$5 Nachos
$5 Quesadilla
$5 Chicken Wings

** 1 item minimum for the show **

results.description:
Greg from Heino's Ski Shop will be speaking about ski boot fitting.  Come and find out how to have the most comfortable boots ever.

Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation (OM) community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. The event is free! The door will open at 7:30 sharp and we will go until about 9:30. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]
results.name: OM Community Potluck! Open For All!

results.name: SCP meet up

results.description:
Thursday nights are now a potluck dinner night for the Orgasmic Meditation community here in NYC! And anyone over 18 who wants to check it out too!

If you are someone who already OMs or if you are curious and want to meet the OM community and check it out, or just meet some awesome people and enjoy a warm and electric evening of connection, come join us!!

Bring an item of food if you desire, and we will provide some extra food too so don't worry about it if you can't or don't have time. 

It's a casual atmosphere that might include some connection games. It's a great way to introduce friends to the concept of OM and the community itself since there will be lots of people there with years of experience in the practice. 

OMing will not take place AT the event but for those trained in the art there will be a circle beforehand at the usual time. 

The event is free! The door will open at 7:45 sharp and we will go until about 9:15. You're welcome to come anytime in between, unlike our other events which have tighter time tables. BUT we can't guarantee there will be any food left and you might miss some fun so try to come on time! 

If you have any questions please contact Marissa Ward -[masked] / [masked]
results.name: OM Community Potluck Night!! Open to All

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

results.description:
Tango Thursdays - Live Tango Music since 2009

This week: Adam Tully Trio

Adam Tully - guitar and host

Emilio Teubal- piano

Pedro Giraudo - bass

Our night is more than a live music show: it's a social and cultural event and it turns the cozy Pane e Vino into a magic place for a few hours every week:

A regular crowd travels from as far as Philadelphia and as near as around the corner each week to meet up for a glass of wine, dinner or dessert.

Dancers socialize, listen to the band, and dance a few numbers, one, two, or three couples at a time.

It's a pretty regular occurrence that one of our tango-singer friends shows up to sing one or two tangos.

Many of our friends choose to celebrate their birthdays with us.

We have such a great time at Tango Thursdays - you should too!

results.description:
VICE and This American Life contributor, Harmon Leon brings his solo storytelling show: Porn, Corn & Body Slamming For Jesus!

Harmon has made a career out of going undercover in disguise and infiltrating extremist subcultures in America. He’s infiltrated everything from white supremacist hate groups to reality TV shows.

Take his hand as he takes you on a multimedia undercover journey to such bizarre places as the Christian Wrestling Federation - where they body slam for Jesus, and the world of being a clothed extra on a porn movie called "Throat Bangers 2."

Weird, wildly original, and incomprehensible, Harmon brings to light the dark side of American culture.

“Hilarious!” – Howard Stern


“One funny motherf*cker!” – Jimmy Kimmel


“A comedy force to be reckoned with.” – *****Edinburgh List


“Leon takes a risk with his comedy and audiences should too.” – *****Adelaide Advertiser


“See this if you truly want to see something edgy, funny and different!” – Rip It Up/Australia

results.description:
Here's to our second Meet-up!


3 Porn Demos so far!

Firstly, we will have at least one GearVR with a few pre-loaded porn movies from Virtual Real Porn. If you have a GearVR please contact me and maybe we can work something out so that we have more

If you have not tried VR Porn yet you have to come!

We are also going to have a two presentations:

1. Robert Gay: A Sexual Visualization of The Stock Market

He will overview a bizarre yet interesting idea in which stocks are objectified into virtual sexual beings. Essentially, if you are looking for a stock that generates ~20m in revenue per year, and you think blue eyes are hot, the computer will personify a stock that makes that much into a woman or man that has blue eyes. So, instead of looking at a bunch of numbers to make your investment decisions you are now looking out at a sea of men and/or women just waiting to be "taken home":)

2. Robert Doyle: The VR Porn Market Now+Future Growth. 

The famous one-liner is that is thrown around now is that the VR business is going to be a 1 billion dollar industry by 2025. The thing is, how do we get there? With that question in mind, I will be sharing the research Agent Smut has put together.

Hope to see you all there and as always... FREE COFFEE + DONUTS!!!
results.name: VR+A --> Porn Demo+Presentations!!!

results.description:
Running is a good workout. Running up a hill is an awesome workout. Be awesome!


Every week is an adventure in hill work. Every week is different. Some workouts include...


30 minute continuous run. Sprint up the 0.4 mile incline, touch the graffiti wall at the top, turn around and jog back to the bottom and then repeat.

http://vimeo.com/81450322

Timed interval sprints. 45 seconds as hard as you can up. 1 minute and 45 seconds recovery jog back to the start. You will be winded!

http://vimeo.com/81966561

Obstacle course training. Workout stations with short sprints between them. Sprint to the first, do a bunch of situps. Sprint to the next, do some lunges. Sprint a bit further and do some squats. Sprint to the top and do some pushups. Jog back to the start and repeat.

This event is officially hosted by The Rise, NYC. They host morning workouts every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday mornings. See them on meetup here:


http://www.meetup.com/The-Rise-NYC/


NOTE: there is NO secure place to store bags, valuables, etc. Please use caution and do not bring anything you cannot afford to lose. If you do leave your belongings at the bottom of the bridge (where we start running) be aware that there is a lot of foot traffic and it would not be surprising if something "walked away."
results.how_to_find_us: Meet at the bottom of the Manhattan side of the Williamsburg Bridge.
results.name: Hill Running Challenge with The Rise

为进一步贯彻落实国家留学政策,响应国家对留学人员”发挥作用”的号召，支持更多留学人员回国工作和创业, 由神州学人编辑部和北美华人科技工商联合会联合举办“小规模专家学者午餐座谈会”以及“海外留学人员创业发展求职交流洽谈大会”2015年10月23至24日将在纽约召开。届时，国内近20余家高校及企业等相关用人单位负责人都将参与其中。参会人员包括了正在或者曾在美国、加拿大留学、工作和生活的留学生、华人华侨。专业领域涉及电子信息、生物与制药、资源与环境、光机电一体化、新材料、新能源与高效节能、科技农业、现代服务业、文化创意及其他高新技术领域。我们欢迎任何领域的海外专家学者，留学人员前来与各个企业高校的代表人当面洽谈。

1. “小规模专家学者午餐座谈会”10月23日上午10:00-2:00（欢迎您推荐人选,仅限教授，学术领头人，专利以及项目负责人）地点有待通知

2. “海外留学人员创业发展求职交流洽谈大会”10月24日上午9:00 – 12:00 (8点15至8点45提供早餐) 纽约大学医学院，NYU Hospital for jointdiseases（2nd ave & 17th St.）Loeb Auditorium. 地址： 301 E 17th St, New York, NY 10003

请注意两个活动面向群体不同，地点不同

results.description: Today’s cities are huge networks of people, organizations, and infrastructure. Goods are imported and produced. Waste must be managed. Cities are becoming more sustainable, but can we go beyond that? Instead of just reducing our footprint, is it possible to create regenerative cities that still meet our human needs? Can our problems actually become solutions? The Urban Permaculture Conference (UPC) will kickstart a dialogue and strengthen alliances among key players in the urban sustainability movement. It will bring together urban professionals, researchers, and permaculture designers to expand their interdisciplinary toolboxes. The UPC will showcase the connections between permaculture design, green architecture, engineering, science, city planning, and sustainability education. We will lay the foundation for a safer and greener tomorrow because each field contributes to the greater whole. Permaculture is a design philosophy that emphasizes integration and whole-systems methodology. Permaculture can create a model for urban revitalization through a city infrastructure that’s both functional and beautiful, but it can also empower citizens socially and economically---not just through the city landscape. Permaculture can enhance community diversity, promote food and water security, and strengthen local economies. Beyond Organic Design (BOD) is hosting the UPC in partnership with the City College of New York (CCNY). The UPC features speakers who are experts in permaculture, architecture, engineering, parks, and city planning. This cutting-edge event will be dynamic and interactive with exciting workshops, panels, and group discussions. But it’s not just all talk. There will be community tours, good food and drink, a screening of the new permaculture movie INHABIT, live music, and much more. The UPC will demonstrate possibilities for creating a regenerative urban model that benefits city dwellers around the world. Beyond Organic Design (BOD), located in New York City, offers sustainability education, events planning, and ecological design services for public and private clients. Early registration is suggested. Go to www.BeyondOrganicDesign.com.
results.name: The First Urban Permaculture Conference: October 23 - 25, 2015 at CCNY
