results.description:
Please join a fun and friendly group of people who are interested in playing a variety of games. Examples of games that we play include:

Word games - Word on the Street, Buzzword, Taboo, Wordie Wars, Snatch-it

Party and social games - Consensus, Apples to Apples, Dixit, Telestrations, 5 Second Rule, Awkward Family Photos,

Lighter strategy games - Ticket to Ride, Qwirkle, Carcassonne, 

Medium to heavier strategy games - Settlers of Catan, Old Dominion, Spyrium, Tzolk'in

Cooperative games - Forbidden Island, Flashpoint, Police Precinct

Card games - Parade, Station Master, Slide 5, Mill Bornes, Bohnanza,

Trivia games - Split Decision, Malarkey, Trivial Pursuit

Role playing games - Werewolf, Resistance, Avalon

Please feel free to bring your own games as well - there are always people looking to learn something new or to find a new favorite board game.

Transportation - for those who drive, there is ample parking in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center. For those who commute by bus, the Q13 and Q28 bus lines stop here. 

We encourage members to purchase food, drinks, and snacks at Panera Bread, so please refrain from bringing outside food and drinks. We want Panera to enjoy our presence!

If you're looking to play fun games with a really nice group of people, come meet up with us at Panera Bread in the Bay Terrace Shopping Center.  Newcomers are always welcome!


If you want to join our Facebook group to get the latest news on board games, hot deals on games, buying/selling games, or simply just to connect with other gamers, please join us here:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/queensboardgames/

www.CliftonYogaNJ.com

for more information or you can email through this meetup group or at [masked]. Text or call (email and text are fastest) directly (862) 621-9642.


Your first class is $10.  Future classes are sold in groups of 4 classes for $40 (still $10 per class).  NO gym membership required.  If you miss a class, you do NOT lose the class- it just stays in your account for future use :) but expires one year from purchase.  This is a wonderful class that builds upon your connection to your inner voice, connects you to your inner wisdom and divine consciousness.  You will build strength, flexibility and peace of mind... come join our group! :)

results.description:
Have you ever seen a movie based on a Jane Austin novel, like Pride and Prejudice, and admired the dance scenes? Looking for a way to meet people of all ages, learn a new skill, and exercise your mind and body all at the same time?

Come join us for a free evening of English country dance with a live band and caller! This dance will be geared towards beginners and there will be plenty of friendly, experienced English country dancers to partner up with you and make sure you have a great time.

To get a sense of what an English country dance looks like, click here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KnZbYtbxmnE

Please bring soft soled dancing shoes and a water bottle. We request that our guests and members avoid wearing scents or strongly scented products on the dance floor.

This event is partially sponsored by Country Dance * New York, which has been hosting English country and contra dancing at The Church of the Village for over seventy years. We can be found in the gym on the lower level of the church almost every Tuesday evening at 7:00, between early September and mid June.

The church is easily accessible to all public transit: Take the 1,2, 3, A, C, E, F, or M trains to 14th street. The church is a lovely stone building on the northwest corner of 13th street and 7th avenue.

For more information, check out our website:

http://cdny.org

And join us on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/
results.name: English as a Second Language: Free English Country Dance!

results.description:
SPECIAL EVENT!!!!  FREE ADMISSION!!!!

Beverly Francis will call a beginner friendly English country dance with live musical accompaniment.

Come dance to a live caller and band with Country Dance New York.  We are an intergenerational, multiethnic, smoke and alcohol free, inclusive community with one thing in common:  we love to contra and English country dance! 

English country dance is choreographed community dancing, with repertoire ranging from court dances of the 1650s through dances composed this year. If you’ve seen any of the Jane Austen movies, you’ve glimpsed some kinds of ECD.

Please bring a pair of clean, soft soled shoes {no spike heels} to dance in, and a water bottle.  We ask that you not use strongly scented grooming products as the smell can become overwhelming on the dance floor when things start to heat up. 

Country Dance New York has been hosting contra dances most Saturdays, and English country dancing most Tuesdays, at Church of the Village for almost 70 years.   COV is located at 201 W. 13 St., on the northwest corner of 7th Avenue.  

Beginners' session on Saturdays {for contra} is from 7:30 to 8:00.  Dancing for all from 8:00 until 10:45.  Hang out with us at a local diner after the dance.

Beginner's session on Tuesdays {for ECD} is from 7:00 to 7:30.  Dancing for all from 7:30 to 10:30.

Cost:  FREE! FREE!  FREE!

To see what contra dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mM5vNzFxxBs 

To see what English country dancing looks like, click here:

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rB40AvJnMUY 

Join us on Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/2449906414/

For a complete schedule of our upcoming season, and for more information, visit our website.

See you on the dance floor!
results.name: FREE! ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE: SPECIAL ENGLISH COUNTRY DANCE

results.description:
Friday night is the evening we get to meet to study the Bible together. We do this 1 - 2 times a month. I've been blessed by the surge of interest in this meetup.  We're a small group of Christians who like to study the Bible.  We're studying the gospel of John.  Lord willing, we will be starting in on John 4 and progressing as the Spirit leads. We love discussion and sometimes don't get over many verses.  The only prerequisite for RSVP'ing for this meetup is a love for studying the Bible and if you have that, you will enjoy your time. I would like to encourage you recent signups to RSVP and come. Also there are a bunch of you other Christians out there who haven't made it yet. Just RSVP and come.  How else will you know if you like it or not?  It's free and it's inspirational.

The meetup is held in the basement of a church we rent for the occasion located at: 42 E 5th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11218.  It's in a quiet community with plenty of curbside parking available and just across the pedestrian bridge from the Fort Hamilton Pkwy F & G train stop.  We meet at 7:30 and spend about 1.5 hrs together.

We're looking for a good time of learning from God's Word together.  God's blessings to you.  We're looking forward to seeing you at the meetup.


In Christian love,

     Tim

I'm a farm-to-table chef living in Inwood, aka "Upstate Manhattan" the beautiful park community with almost nowhere good to eat. I'm doing what I can to change that through pop-ups and the occasional secret dinner in my apartment. My approach is ingredients-based, i.e. I find something beautiful and build a dish around it. There are no other rules, although my style tends towards the rustic. Here's the menu(there will be beverage options of course): Caramelized onion, manchego, & white anchovy tart
Roasted green tomatoes stuffed with silken tofu, cilantro & spices, thai bbq chicken wing
Smoky butternut squash chili with pork, beans, hominy & greens

Spiced wine poached pears, cardamom ice cream

What to Expect.
Relax. It's Easy.

 

Classes are led by experts, many with thousands of hours of experience and deep knowledge and skill. In addition, there are often people training to become instructors who are happy to offer individual guidance.

 

Classes are tailored to the needs of the attendees. A starter session will be given if there are newcomers. New techniques and insights are always available for regulars. Advanced techniques may also be explored.

 

Classes begin with a brief announcement and introduction followed by 30-40 minutes of instruction and practice. Typically, classes are no more than an hour. Not long, considering the benefits can last a life time.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

Hello all! Join us for the Fall Social BBQ to say Goodbye to Good Weather!! This will be hosted at the apartment of a new member of the community. She just moved into the UES so we will also be using this as an apartment warming. She lives just off the 86th Street stop on the 456 line. Because of space limitations we will only be allowing 20 RSVPs, sorry!


This is a Potluck event! Please bring some food and/or drinks (booze) with you. Homemade items are fun but not required. There will be an electric grill for making food but we will not be buying a large quantity of food. We will provide the cutlery and basic condiments. There is a Fairway nearby at 86th between 2nd and 3rd if anyone wants to buy some stuff without carrying a long distance - Fairway is really quite cheap for this area! We usually buy our stuff there and it's a good deal and wide selection. https://goo.gl/maps/mhdULJeGZfB2 ;

Gotham Atheists weekly Drinking With Atheists Friday Night Socials!

Join us for a great night of conversation in relaxed company in New York City. We go from 8pm to around 11pm or so.

Every Friday Night for 8 years we have gathered to enjoy the evening and the company of each other. Every week we meet at someone's apartment, a park, or a bar. DWA (Drinking With Atheists) is for Atheists, agnostics, Skeptics, Philosophers, Humanists, Freethinkers, Brights, secularists, inquiring minds, and all around nice people. No agenda but good light conversations. Great chance to meet new people and make new friends.

See you Friday Night.

Lee

results.description:
Hyphen Hub presents Visions of the Future in partnership with CultureHub

Visions of the Future is a showcase night of cutting-edge multimedia art and performance focusing on new forms of audio-visual interpretation about visions of the future. The night will feature eight leading artists presenting works of immersive audience experience. It will be presented in partnership with CultureHub at their new space in La MaMa. 

Artists involved include: Catalonian Cyborg pioneers Neil Harbisson and Moon Ribas. Harbisson will perform A Concert from Space via his antenna that is embedded into his skull. Ribas will showcase her piece Waiting for Earthquakes, where she connects her sensors to the seismology satellite in space and dance as earthquakes happen at any given moment, The two artists will perform simultaneously. 

MSHR duo and Portland-based artists Brenna Murphy and Birch Cooper produce unusual installations and live performances that revolve around a unique system of light-audio feedback, employing handmade synthesizers, sculptural interfaces and ritualistic shamanic performances, placing the human body into a dynamic relationship between the ultra-terrestrial and the tribal. 

Juan Cortes and Ricardo Arias, both artists visiting from Bogota, Colombia for MOMA’s hybrid media exhibition, present their latest performance collaborating as “The Migrants”. Tidal Flares is a performance-installation that draws its inspiration from the dramatic effect of solar flares on the Earth’s behaviors, in both its organic and its inorganic systems. The performers will interfere/interact with this activity via sensors in ways akin to those deployed by certain biological organisms such as bioluminiscent algae, frogs, tarantulas etc. 

Yucef Merhi, a New York based Venezuelan artist, will present Facial Poetry, a playful multiuser installation where facial gestures are transformed into hundreds of poems. 

Mark Bolotin will showcase The Lumiphonic Creature Choir, a futuristic installation which consists of a giant twelve-headed multimedia creature that triggers faces talking about their vision of the future. The audience will be able to interact and play directly with the voices and sounds of the Creature Choir.

Venue: CultureHub, The Downstairs at La MaMa,
66 East 4th Street, New York Times: 8 pm Tickets: General Admission: $15
Students and Artists: $5 

Click here to buy tickets.

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/visions-of-the-future-with-hyphen-hub-tickets-18354621166


 This Hyphen Hub event is in collaboration with CultureHub.
results.name: Hyphen Hub Visions of the Future with CultureHub

results.description:
Sharp’s Appalachian Harvest, Traditional Music via 21st Century Musicians

Don't miss this multi-media folk music show featuring Jeff Davis and Brian Peters at St. John's Church, 81 Christopher Street, Manhattan.


 Sharp’s Appalachian Harvest is a special multi-media music performance by English folk musician Brian Peters and American old-time musician Jeff Davis. Their show is built around the astounding songs and music collected by Englishmen Cecil Sharp and Maud Karpeles. Traversing the Southern Appalachians over the summers of 1916 to 1918, the pair created one of the most extensive folk song collections ever made.

Brian Peters, a leading performer of English traditional songs and music, frequently tours the U.S. as a teacher and performer at such venues as the Swannanoa Gathering and Augusta Heritage Center, as well as festivals and concerts. He’s also gaining a reputation as a researcher of song history.


Jeff Davis, a protégé of Mike Seeger and Frank Warner, both collectors as well as musicians, plays banjo and fiddle and sings with a rare authenticity gained from personal contact with old time musicians.


Their multi-media show features the brightest gems from Cecil Sharp’s harvest of old ballads, dance tunes, children’s songs and gospel. They give readings from Sharp’s diaries describing vividly the hardships and triumphs of song collecting, and show his evocative photographs of the singers and of mountain life.


Contribution: $20; members: $18; fulltime students and children under 15: $10. Tickets are available at the door or online at:  http://sharp.bpt.me (service charge applies).

This event is part of Daniel Pearl World Music Days
results.name: Musical Evening: Sharp's Appalachian Harvest

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:40p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? visit us at www.turnonny.us

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, time it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no 

displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds: Cancel your RSVP ,  24 hours or more before the game and we will make the refund. No refund for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
Every year in Jersey City, along Newark Avenue, there is a huge Navratri / Garba Festival that draws more than 10,000 people.  It is free and excellent, and is sponsored by the Jersey City Asian Merchant Association.

From the official website: "Newark Avenue, in the township of Jersey City, New Jersey sets a unique example during Navratri, where more than fifteen thousand men, women and children play Garba-Raas on the street, all throughout the night, every night for 4-6 nights - a rare spectacle to be observed." Website address: http://www.indiasquare.org

Directions and WHERE TO MEET US: Take the PATH train to Journal Square. When you exit the Journal Square PATH Train station, you will be directly on John F Kennedy Blvd. Walk north along John F Kennedy Blvd three blocks to Newark Ave. That is where the Garba/Navratri Festival is. BUT please keep walking down John F Kennedy Blvd, past Newark Avenue, just slightly more, about 100 feet. You will see a big White Castle Restaurant -- just slightly past the corner of Newark Ave and John F Kennedy Blvd (it is on John F Kennedy Blvd). Do NOT go inside the White Castle! Our group will be meeting between 9:00pm and 9:15pm IN FRONT OF the White Castle at 2995 John F Kennedy Blvd. One of us will be holding a sign that says "MEETUP". Look for the sign, you will see it. Don't be late! After meeting, we will all walk a few feet to the Garba/Navratri Festival on Newark Avenue.

Driving there is problematic because it will be hard to park. We recommend taking the PATH train since it will be almost impossible to park there. But if you want to park far away from the festival, or if somehow you have figured out how to park there, you are very welcome to. The address of our meeting spot (White Castle) is 2995 John F Kennedy Blvd, Jersey City, NJ

See you there, in front of the White Castle, between 9:00pm and 9:15pm. Don't go inside the White Castle, instead just meet us right in front of it. Don't be late!

This event goes until 2:00am in the morning, but you don't have to stay that late of course. Leave whenever is good for you.

David

-----------------------------------------------

Description of Navratri and Garba

Navratri, Where nav means nine and ratri means nights... 

Navratri festival sacred to the Mother Goddess is celebrated in the months of October and November. It is a festival of worship, dance and music celebrated over a period of nine nights. It is celebrated from the first to the ninth date of Ashwin Shukla Paksha of the Hindu Calendar for the worship of the Goddess Durga. This festival commemorates the victory of Goddess Durga over a demon, Mahishasur.

During Navratri, devotees of Durga fast and pray for health and prosperity. It is an occasion for vibrant festivities. The Garba or Dandiya Raas is the most significant feature during the festival of Navratri. This is the traditional and folk dance of the state of Gujarat, but today, everyone performs this dance with great fervor and enthusiasm. During the dance, a decorated pot is ceremoniously placed with a light inside and the women folk dance in a circle, singing 'traditional songs' or 'garbas'.

Then there is a pooja on each day of this holy period where Goddess Durga, known in this state as Ambe Maa is worshipped for prosperity and happiness. During all the nine nights, men, women and children flock together in the street and peform Garba-Raas in circumambulation around the statue of devi, accompanied by religious songs eulogizing the Mother-Goddess in tune with instrumental music till late night which has deep socio-religious impact on the Hindu society. A Mandvi of the Goddess is framed by woodcarving in which a small idol of Mother Goddess is placed with a number of ghee lamps. The devotees put this Mandvi on their heads and maintaining balance, perform Garba-dance.

Gujarat is the cardinal center for the celebration of Navratri Mahotsava, where young men and women wearing traditional attire dance with zeal, joy, jubilation and devotional fervor, till late mid-night. Out of the nine forms of Mother-Goddess, the triumvirate of Mahakali, Maha-Laxmi and Maha-Sarasvati symbolize prowess, affluence and erudition - the most essential things for the prosperity and progress of mankind. the Mother-Goddess grants all these three to the devotees who observe Navratri in right spirit. 

-----------------------------------------------

results.name: Navratri / Garba Festival in Jersey City - Free

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

Join us at 8am for a run to Hoboken Pier A and back.
http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121375029

Yes, there is a waterfront route to Hoboken. Enjoy the fun of cruising around Hoboken Pier A; around the new park and children playground at Newport where you will feel if you are at the beach. Get inspired by the man made majestic views of Manhattan!

The mapped distance is approx. 5.88 miles. You may run less or more in that time. We turn back after running 30 min to be back at 9 am. Hyatt pier is .31 miles so a double loop gets some runners 6.5 miles on this run.

9 am we run to Liberty State Park, a favorite place to run for most of us. Run on!

results.description:
Team PIE will host its second annual Defend the North fighting game tournament from October 24-25 featuring seven popular games: Guilty Gear XRD, Killer Instinct, Ultra Street Fighter 4, Mortal Kombat X, Super Smash Bros Melee & Wii-U, and Ultimate Marvel VS Capcom 3.

For the first time, Defend the North will also showcase related elements of the fighting game community, such as cosplayers, art, apparel, and FGC-related companies.
The games will be streamed online via Team Spooky on Twitch.TV and casted by Arturo Sanchez. Team Spooky has over 120,000 followers and 62 million views on their page. Last year's Defend the North stream garnered over 80,000 views in two days.

Notable competitors such as: EMP Hiro, STC Dieminion, STC Sanford, STC Yipes, PIE SMug, PIE Zues, Liquid Knuckle Du, and Killer Instinct EVO 2014 winner STC CDjr will also be in attendance. More will be announced in the coming months.

"[Team Pie] has a vision to host the first event that truly unifies the fighting game community in New York City in all of its facets,” said Andy Dumornay, CEO and Founder of Team PIE. “The FGC in the tri-state area does not have a home. Defend the North is here to give them that home. We plan on giving participants and spectators alike a unified experience uniquely deserving of competitive fighting games."

Defend the North is a Capcom qualifer ranked tournament in the Capcom Pro Tour, along with the EVO Championship Series, CEO, Dreamhack, SummerJam, Combo Breaker, and more.

Click here to go to the website!

For more information on DTN 2015 and sponsorship opportunities or to schedule interviews with staff, shoutcasters, or players, please contact: [masked]
results.name: Second Annual Defend the North Tournament

results.description:
This hike takes place just west of Ithaca, NY, so it's only accessible by car, and the travel time from Manhattan is around five hours each way, leaving 10 hours of travel and only 2 hours of moderate hiking (1,900 ft. of elevation change). But the scenery along the hike, in a river gorge adjoining Watkins Glen, NY, is spectacular. We pass by 19 waterfalls, two of which you can walk under. You will definitely want to take photos here.

As there is no public transportation to the hike, in order to go, you have to put yourself on the waiting list. If you note in your RSVP that you can drive and how many passengers you can take, I will take you off the waiting list and confirm you, as well as the next group of passengers who can fill your vehicle. Passengers will be expected to arrange a meeting place and reimbursement for gas, tolls, and the $8 per vehicle park entry fee. We will plan to meet at the main park entrance parking lot (off Franklin Street in Watkins Glen, NY) between 1 and 2 p.m.


There is a swimming pool in the park that is included in the entry fee, so you may want to bring a towel and swimsuit. Even though it will be autumn, there will probably still be mosquitoes, so bug repellent is advised. Although much of the hike is in the shadow of the gorge walls, you will want sunscreen as well. And because the trail is moderate and only a little over two miles, you should be okay with any type of footwear and at least a liter of water. Lunch and dinner will be on the road most likely.

If you get nervous in enclosed spaces, this might not be a good hike, as the trail does go through tight spaces, tunnels, and caves.


Trail map: http://nysparks.com/parks/attachments/WatkinsGlenTrailMap.pdf

Video: https://youtu.be/6dy3UWWkllA
results.name: Watkins Glen Gorge Hike

results.description:
When people hear about meditation, they almost always say that they have either never tried it or they were not able to do it. You may have expected that thoughts were supposed to go away, but when you closed your eyes, more thoughts than ever came up.

We invite you to come and experience how meditation can happen effortlessly with a little attention to our very own breath! The free session will include light yoga, breathing techniques and relaxing meditation and will be led by one of the volunteers of the Art of Living foundation.

 

Art of Living Secaucus Center
Email: <a>[masked]</a>
Phone: <a>[masked]</a>
Meetup: <a>http://www.meetup.com/Lets-Meditate-Secaucus/</a>;
Twitter: https://twitter.com/#secaucusaol
Web: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus
results.how_to_find_us: http://www.artofliving.org/us-en/secaucus
results.name: Art of Living Free Meditation

results.description:
Since August, 2011, Heights Meditation has been meeting on Saturday mornings and this meeting--because of its timing and format--is many meditators' favorite. 

The meeting is held every Saturday morning from 8:00 am until 9:00 am at Our Savior's Atonement Lutheran Church.  Like all Heights Meditation meetings, there is no charge.

All meetings begin with the moderator helping everyone to find a comfortable position and come into a relaxed yet focused state. Participants are briefly walked through their bodies while sitting quietly. A period of silent follows for 20-25 minutes. Whenever the mind wanders and seeks out a satisfaction outside of the self, the meditator steers consciousness back to her breath. In this way we practice mindfulness, focus, and discernment. The mind simplifies its activities as the body relaxes.

Meditation is easy to do but, like most simple things, mastery requires regular practice. Most anyone who practices the technique once a day will note its transformative effect on their life. Meditation makes you ready to be happy and content.

The sangha at Heights Meditation is a friendly and open-hearted group. Please come visit us if meditation seems attractive or necessary to you in your life or if you have had trouble establishing and keeping up your meditation practice as a lone agent!

If you have any questions, please contact us at [masked] or take a look at our main website at HeightsMeditation.com. Thank you!

results.description:
Hey Guys - we scrapped the full-day retreat because too many people already had plans that weekend. Don't worry, we'll host more in the coming months. 

That said, I was planning on driving my SUV up to the Hudson Valley on Saturday and I'd like to stick to that plan! That means, 7 guys can join me for:

- a day-trip out of the city

- a light hike

- unstructured exploring (when's the last time you did that?) - if we want to apple pick, hit a local farmers market, go to a museum, drive to a cool coffee shop, or just take in the scenery...we can do whatever we want!

- I'll bring water, snacks, and a cooler...you bring a packed lunch or money to buy a food

- this is FREE but I would appreciate $10-20 donation for gas & tolls if you can swing it

I only have spots for 7 more people so please RSVP quickly. I wanted to invite this group first bc you guys rock...and then I'll extend to other guys. Again, this will be a fun day-trip out of the city for nearly no money...just a nice group of men, foliage, and time to relax and explore together.

Message me if you have any questions!

results.description:
Admission: Round Trip Ticket $28

http://www.nysec.org/sites/default/files/styles/medium/public/images/hike_0.jpg?itok=ANFWH716  Join us on a hike to Bull Hill in historic Cold Spring, NY.  This 5-hour hike will take us to a summit over the Hudson River. You will be rewarded with stunning views of the river and, on a clear day, Manhattan.  We will take a scenic train ride to the town of Cold Spring.  The town, set on the east bank of Hudson, has many antique stores, nice coffee shops, several restaurants, and a couple of lovely parks (Stony Point and West Point Foundry) for those who may be interested in taking a stroll on their own.  This town is worth a day's visit even if you do not hike!    

The ride on Metro North Hudson line takes an hour and twenty minutes and offers spectacular views of the river.  We will meet at the information booth at Grand Central at 8:30am.   If you arrive after that time, find us on the train that leaves at 8:43am.  The round trip ticket is $28. Please buy your own tickets.  Bring a water bottle, light lunch and/or snack for the trail, and a few dollars for a coffee stop at a local cafe.  Wear hiking or sturdy walking shoes (there are some steep parts on decent), and dress in layers for the hike.    Rain cancels. 

If anyone from NYSEC is planning just to go to Cold Spring on that day, there is a free guided history tour of the West Point Foundry Preserve (which is just by the train station) from 11am - 12:30 PM. For more infor see Scenic Hudson Events | Scenic Hudson

results.description:
Advice for Saturday:


Camera:


Bring wide angle lenses or Wide Zoom.


Bring extra batteries if you have them.


The best way to get the images to the event headquarters in time to post them on the Flickr site is letting me download your camera to my my laptop at the end of the event.  


Shoot on JPEG vs RAW, last year I shot over 1500 shots on RAW, we need to get our shots to the event coordinator within a week, and you will not have time to edit every shot in RAW in PhotoShop and LightRoom, the people that make these teams want to see their images posted ASAP, and they are posted to Flickr in JPG.


Dress:


It is supposed to be cold, Frosty according to the weather reports.   Dress in layers!  


Food:  


There will be a limited breakfast provided of cereals, granola bars, fruits, juices, coffee and water.


I suggest you bring your own lunches and drinks as needed.


This shoot will be very fun, but it is also a shoot for charity.   As such, we need to get all of our shots for the event to the event coordinator within a week.

results.description:
Weather permitting, come join us for outdoor tennis at Washington Park in Union City, which is off of the 9th Street light rail station. Bring your sweats, your racquet, plenty of water and balls and we'll see you there! As this event is not designed to match up folks, courts are assigned on first-come first-served basis. So get in early and grab a court.


Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game.

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending.

Although we won't enforce attendance, it would be polite to attend if you commit because others are looking to find others to hit with.

Cross your fingers that it won't rain as inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

results.description:
Details:

1 game (7 v 7) : Two halves of 30 minutes each with a break in between

-Please bring a fun and chill attitude. Absolutely no rough playing, slide-tackling or berating others; You’ll be asked to leave.

-Turf, AG cleats, or sneakers - no wet ground monster spikes.

-$4.00 goes for maintaining the website, equipment, and organization.

Rules:

This is a chill game so please bring a chill attitude; no meatheads or a$$holes. Organizers have the final say (i.e. if a ball is out of bounds we call it). 
It’s a small pitch so no corners kicks; just throwins.

Directions:

How to get to Brooklyn Bridge Park PIER 2 Sports Field:

To get past the BQE, you must enter Brooklyn Bridge Park on foot either fromm the south (at Joralemon St. & Furman St.) or the north (at Old Fulton St. & Furman St.)  Pier 2 is roughly halfway between these two entrances.  We play on the artificial grass field at the far end of the pier, behind the basketball courts & roller rink.

Google these coordinates:[masked], [masked]

Brooklyn Bridge Park is accessible by several subway lines (A/C, 2/3, 4/5, F, R) and bus routes (B25, B63)

Cancellation:

We'll play rain or shine.  We'll only cancel if there are fewer than 10 people going, or if there's lightning in the area.

results.description:
For this Healthy Neighborhoods Mobile Market volunteer effort in Harlem, please also register through the City Harvest website. Use the following link to register:


https://cityharvestvolunteers.civicore.com/index.php?section=indGpRegistrations&action=profile_conditional&fwID=3975


The Registration process is as follows:


• Follow the Group Sign-up Link above and click "New User" to create a new volunteer profile and click "Submit" (repeat volunteers can simply log in)

• Read project details and click "Register" to confirm participation

• You will then receive a confirmation email and a reminder the day before the project


Only 10 volunteers are needed. All volunteers must be 18 years and older.

Description of Duties:

Volunteers will be stationed at 3-4 market tables, each supplied with thousands of pounds of fresh produce that they will help distribute to eligible market-goers. Sample produce items may include bananas, onions, cabbage, or potatoes. As the market-goers stop by each table, volunteers greet them-and then weigh and bag the produce. Note: All food is distributed free of charge.


That's it for now. If you have any questions, feel free to give me (Daniel) a call or text at [masked]. Thanks!

About City Harvest Healthy Neighborhoods Program


Nearly 1.4 million New Yorkers are facing hunger and for many people that City Harvest serves, healthy food is unavailable and unaffordable. In turn, diseases related to poor nutrition – including diabetes and heart disease – tend to be concentrated where demand for emergency food is greatest.

As a natural extension of the anti-hunger work we began more than 30 years ago, City Harvest developed Healthy Neighborhoods programs to respond to the need for emergency food, improve access to fruits and vegetables for residents in low-income communities and provide nutrition education that will inspire affordable, healthy meal choices. Through our Healthy Neighborhoods programs, City Harvest partners with residents, community organizations, afterschool programs, and local businesses. Together we work to achieve a long-term impact in the fight against hunger by engaging residents in healthy choices and enhancing the local food landscape. Building off our nutrition education classes which began in 2000, and our Mobile Markets which began in 2004, City Harvest has since expanded Healthy Neighborhoodsprograms to high-need communities across the five boroughs.

We've surveyed our women entrepreneurs and the results are in! It's time to evaluate them and plan our future. Let's meet for coffee (and maybe a bite of baked goods!), and discuss our vision for 2015-16. Come prepared with ideas for meetings, workshops, training - whatever you need and what you think our other members need.

results.description:
Time 9 AM, Jersey City -- Running Weekend Meetup 9AM on Saturday

http://www.mapmyrun.com/routes/view/121385245

Let us go and run in Liberty State Park. Check out the season there!

Enter Liberty park via Jersey Avenue, run on the gravel path of the Grove of Remembrance. Run along the Freedom way, pass the interpretive center to the parking lot and picnic area at the end.
Then run back along the waterfront with the Statue of Liberty and the awesome view of Manhattan skyline.
Total 6.75+ miles.

We shall be running a loop so you may take shortcuts or longer paths on the way!

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
